intro: Rhynchotechum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed rhynchotechum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Rhynchotechum longipes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and grasslands.
